1.title: Um lugar para voltar (A place to go back to)
1.plot: Six actors form the theater group galegos e frangalhos. In this program we see how the youth tackle their existencial problems, studying and working. In the meanwhile the group rehearses for a public street performance.

2.title: Plantar, colher e comer (Planting, harvesting and eating)
2.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

3.title: Sobre rodas numa ilha (On a isle by bike)
3.plot: Five young characters who work with bicycles, either repairing, or being a courier or making accessories for it. How do they manage to survive working with this alternative economic product.

4.title: Isso me faz pensar (That makes me think)
4.plot: This episode shows a beat boy dancer, a female and male rapper and a rap poet, who live on the outskirts of Porto Alegre, in the south of Brazil. How do they work together, express themselves and survive although they are poor? And how do they tackle racism, very present in the Brazilian society?

5.title: Eu me sinto infinito (I feel myself infinite)
5.plot: This program shows 5 young characters who live in the periphery of Curitiba and work together. A producer, director, photographer, dancer and editor making video productions like video clips, dance videos and other audiovisual productions. How do they work together, being from the poor outskirts and what are their problems and dreams working with cinema.

locations: Porto Alegre, Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil
Pelotas, Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil
imdb.plot outline: Culturing presents alternative, economic and cultural experiences through urban youths involved in creative collectives. Beyond showing the cultural expression of the young voices that live on the edges of Brazil's urban centers, the series present collaborative collectives that are developing their territories in a sustainable way.
imdb.title: Culturando
plot: Culturing presents alternative, economic and cultural experiences through urban youths involved in creative collectives. Beyond showing the cultural expression of the young voices that live on the edges of Brazil's urban centers, the series present collaborative collectives that are developing their territories in a sustainable way.
